alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 05 at 2:55PM EDT until July 05 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ST. MARYS COUNTY... At 254 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near White Point Beach, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Lexington Park, Leonardtown, Piney Point, Tall Timbers, Saint Inigoes Creek, Saint Marys City, Saint George Island, Saint Marys River, White Point Beach, California, Patuxent River Naval Air Station, Dameron, Valley Lee, Scotland, Point Lookout, Great Mills, Redgate, Drayden, Saint Inigoes and Park Hall. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
